channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big Banks Credit ‘Resilient’ Economy for Profit Growth
item.description: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs, Citi and Wells Fargo reported strong earnings, mostly topping analyst expectations and showing broad growth.

item.title: A Nobel Prize for explaining when technology leads to growth
item.description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in economics was awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt.

item.title: Now Comes the Hard Part for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
item.description: Hamas released hostages and agreed to abide by a cease-fire, but persuading it to lay down its arms is another matter.

item.title: For Uniqlo’s Founder, Conquering America Is Personal
item.description: Tadashi Yanai champions the U.S. market as vital for Uniqlo’s growth, but remains deeply concerned about rising American protectionism.

item.title: Hoping to Steady Political Crisis, French Prime Minister Offers to Suspend Pension Overhaul
item.description: The move by Sébastien Lecornu was a major concession as he faced no-confidence votes that threatened to topple his government again this week.

item.title: Suspect Pleads Guilty in Firebombing of Pa. Governor’s Residence
item.description: Under a plea agreement, Cory Balmer will be imprisoned for 25 to 50 years for the attack on Gov. Josh Shapiro’s official residence in Harrisburg, Pa.,...

item.title: Maine Gov. Janet Mills enters crowded Democratic race to unseat Susan Collins
item.description: Mills was reportedly recruited by Democratic Senate leaders after her high-profile confrontation with President Donald Trump in February, in which she...

item.title: Data centers are booming. But there are big energy and environmental risks
item.description: How tech companies and government officials handle local impacts will shape the industry's future in the U.S.

item.title: Questions remain about deceased Israeli hostages in Gaza
item.description: The tenuous ceasefire in the two-year Israel-Hamas war appears to be holding even as complex issues remained ahead.

item.title: What's next for Gaza. And, ICE tactics are reportedly becoming more violent
item.description: With the first phase of a ceasefire holding, eyes are on what is next for Gaza. And, ICE agents are ramping up arrest operations in several cities and...

item.title: To Meet Pledges to Save Forests Spending Must Triple, U.N. Report Says
item.description: Four years after a global pledge to end deforestation, the amount of money going toward conserving and restoring forests is not enough, the analysis f...

item.title: China Wants Foreign Scientists. The Public Says No, Thanks.
item.description: Since Beijing announced a new visa to attract young science and technology graduates, a backlash has erupted online, forcing the government to respond...

item.title: Hoping to Steady Political Crisis, French Prime Minister Offers to Suspend Pension Overhaul
item.description: The move by Sébastien Lecornu was a major concession as he faced no-confidence votes that threatened to topple his government again this week.

item.title: Madagascar’s Embattled President Is Impeached
item.description: President Andry Rajoelina has vowed to remain in office despite violent protests against his government.

item.title: Now Comes the Hard Part for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
item.description: Hamas released hostages and agreed to abide by a cease-fire, but persuading it to lay down its arms is another matter.
